title: "Precision" similar to Nasalization but not rounded
content:
I'm having a bear of a time ID'ing this font. The only one I can think of off the top of my head is Nasalization, but this one is almost entirely angular. I did some forums searches, but almost everything relating to NASA is harsh critiques of the "meatball." :) Thanks for taking time out of your day to help.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [precision.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072222/http:/typophile.com/files/precision.gif) | 26.95 KB |
author: OptimusChyme

comments.content: Looks like the same as used for the movie, "Tron".
Do you need an exact match? I've got a big list of alternatives.
Anything close is fine - I don't mind modifying it by hand, just starting from scratch. Thanks!

But do you have to match it? It's not so good. Seems to me, you'd do better with a more well-drawn typeface that exudes the same feeling.

[Stop](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072222/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Stop)  
 [Interceptor](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072222/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=Interceptor)  
 [Transpond](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072222/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=transpond)

I agree with you, Stephen, but I'm matching existing marketing materials and the customer is not looking for a total rebranding at this time. I appreciate the suggestions. Looks like this is going to be a re-creation heavy affair.
Spend the money on recreation or use a better typeface? Tell them to weigh their options.
